transcript.text: What do you know already about risks to Intellectual Property? Explore Maria’s situation, select all the appropriate responses and then click on Submit.

contentText.text: Maria began working at Johnson Controls a few months ago and has been involved with the launch of a new product, which is causing excitement in the industry.
Maria’s friend, Pete, who is in a similar industry, asks her how her job is going and starts to ask specific questions about the new product.

instructionText.text: Select all the appropriate responses and then click on Submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

extraInstructionText.text: There may be more than one correct answer.

optionContent.option: She should make Pete promise not to reveal anything she is about to tell him before discussing details of the product and the launch
She should tell Pete how she feels about the work (e.g., it's exciting, challenging, etc.) without revealing any details about the product or the launch
She should tell Pete that the work she is doing is confidential and she can't reveal any details
She should only talk about her projects and share details that aren’t available to the general public with close friends and family that she trusts

correct.text: Maria can tell Pete how she feels about the work, but shouldn’t reveal any of the company’s confidential information – including details about the new product or its launch.
The key point to remember is to NEVER reveal trade secrets or any other confidential information to unauthorized people outside our company for any reason.
Under no condition should even trusted friends and family be made aware of trade secrets being used or IP being developed by Johnson Controls.
